Tucson raises a hand in complete agreement.

" I give Leo Prime all of my s=
upport on this topic.  And as a Prime myself I wish to see this change foll=
ow through faithfully. "

He turns his head in Leo Prime's direction.

" Ea=
rth is not our home but Cybertron is. We must right the wrongs that have be=
en committed and send the Predicons and Decepticons to an exile that will p=
revent them from ever returning to this planet."

He too, with the faceplat=
e and near voice pattern of Optimus Prime, Tucson Prime turns his head to e=
veryone in the room.

" If I'm not mistaken Char is still inhabitable. I su=
ggest we do as Leo Prime suggests and round up our adversaries and exile th=
em to Char as soon as we can all manage."

Straight Shot raises her hand. 
=

" If we're gonna pull it off, a certain Prime is gonna need his sight back=
. Tucson Prime always does so much for all of us.  The least we can do now =
is make him whole again.  "

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 
=

On Jun 22, 2011, at 12:26 PM, "supercyclonus" <supercyclonus@...> wr=
ote:

> OOC: Any Maximal or Autobot can be part of this
> 
> The Maximals a=
nd Autobots are directed to the meeting area, which is near to the front of=
 the Ark bay area. A podium is set up and there are places for everyone to =
either stand up or sit down as is their want. 
> 
> As everyone moved into =
position, LEGACY, LORD ELDER, WINGSABER, SANTON, TORCA and NOCTORRO come in=
 a take positions near the podium itself, but it is the bot known as LEO II=
 that comes up to take the center of the stage. 
> 
> He steps up behind th=
e podium and take a moment to look at the assembled individuals before him.=
 He stands tall and proud, the whites and light browns are caught well in t=
he lights. His form is strong and well built and in his face you can see th=
e likeness of OPTIMUS PRIME himself. Behind him lay the large fallen forms =
of OPTIMUS and MEGATRON locked, even in death, in the eternal struggle of g=
ood versus evil. 
> 
> And it is in this back drop that LEO turned to face =
the assembled mechs and began to speak. 
> 
> "Autobots, Maximals!" LEO's v=
oice is a rich baritone, one that easily carried across the room. "I am sur=
e that you have been all wondering just what this meeting is about." He smi=
led a warm and inviting smile as he looked around the room. "And for those =
who don't know me, I am LEO and have been named a PRIME by the council of e=
lders on Cybertron." He paused for a moment for that to take affect and the=
n continued, "and what I have come here to talk about is Earth, and what we=
 are doing here." 
> 
> LEO paused to make sure that everyone was keeping u=
p and then continued, "I have been sent by the high council and have been d=
iscussing matters with both Your Lord Elder as well as Legacy, both of whom=
 have been instrumental in cataloging events here on Earth, and what has be=
en found we find disturbing."
> 
> There was a glance from LORD ELDER to LE=
O, but it was a nod of agreement, even from LEGACY there was a very slight =
nod, his single optic pulsing slightly. 
> 
> "Does anyone here know how ma=
ny ships have crash landed here on this planet since you have been here?" L=
EO stopped for a moment as he looked at those in the crowd, his optics turn=
ing to look at each of the Maximals and Autobots who were present. 
> 
> Th=
ere were some in the audience who tentatively raised a hand and perhaps eve=
n a few who raised it with confidence, but most kept their hands down, unsu=
re. 
> 
> "What ever you think that number is, multiply it several times." =
LEO PRIME's words were frim and full of convition, "You have to factor in t=
he Predacons and Decepticons that have crash landed here too, and then ther=
e are the ships that crashed and had no survivors and so may have not been =
reported, and of course the largest one that crash landed into the ocean."
=
> 
> LEO PRIME paused for a moment again to let that fact sink in and then =
he spoke. "Most of these ships contained alien minerals, alien metals and a=
lien technologies, objects that have no business being here on this planet =
at this time." 
> 
> Gesturing at the audience LEO PRIME asked another ques=
tion, "Does anyone care to hazard a guess at how many tons of it are here o=
n the Earth now?" 
> 
> He paused again to look at the audience, fewer rais=
ing their hands. 
> 
> "Or how about the last time there was some major bat=
tle and you blew off a piece of someone's armor, or they lost a weapon, or =
perhaps that happened to you?" 
> 
> LEO PRIME's optic's brightened as he w=
ent on, "Has anyone noticed that the humanoids on the planet are beginning =
to learn from us, learning how to use tools and communicate ideas at a fast=
er rate than they historical should have?"
> 
> Slamming his hands down on =
the podium he continued in a stronger voice, "Mechs we are having an impact=
 on this planet, one that we should not be having. The humans have to proce=
ed unmolested on a planet that is supposed to be in a pristine condition wh=
en they inherit it. There should be no leftover smog from our smelting of o=
re, and it should not be being deprived of the very minerals that the human=
s will need to survive. It should not be seeded with technologies that huma=
ns should not be able to fathom for another several million years, and we d=
efinitely should not be having cities here, complete with internal crime an=
d slums."
> 
> LEO straightened as he looked over his audience to be sure t=
hat he still had their attention. He nodded at the affect that he had. "YES=
, we have to stop Unicron and his minions! And YES, we have to round up the=
 Predacons and other assorted criminals that are still running around on th=
is planet. More of which seem to be arriving daily." 
> 
> Gesturing at the=
 audience again LEO sighed, "But we cannot make the Earth our permanent liv=
ing quarters, at least not yet. We have reports of civilians here, setting =
up shop . . . setting up families." He paused again to look at the audience=
, "This planet belongs to the humans and the other animals that live here, =
not us. We do not have the right!" 
> 
> LEO PRIME leaned into the audience=
, "If we continue on the course that we are now, we are no better than the =
Predacons who take what they want. We are Maximals and Autobots, we are bet=
ter than that. We are here to defend it, but this planet, this place, it is=
 not our home, and we cannot, through our desire to defend it turn it into =
one, nor can we allow the Predacons to do so either."
> 
> He straightened,=
 "It is time for a change."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

 topic.  And as a Prime myself I wish to see this change follow throug=
h faithfully. "</div><div><br></div><div>He turns his head in Leo Prime's d=

oice pattern of Optimus Prime, Tucson Prime turns his head to everyone in t=

    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
   =
   
      
      <p>OOC: Any Maximal or Autobot can be part of this<br>
<br=
>
The Maximals and Autobots are directed to the meeting area, which is near=
 to the front of the Ark bay area. A podium is set up and there are places =
for everyone to either stand up or sit down as is their want. <br>
<br>
As =
everyone moved into position, LEGACY, LORD ELDER, WINGSABER, SANTON, TORCA =
and NOCTORRO come in a take positions near the podium itself, but it is the=
 bot known as LEO II that comes up to take the center of the stage. <br>
<b=
r>
He steps up behind the podium and take a moment to look at the assembled=
 individuals before him. He stands tall and proud, the whites and light bro=
wns are caught well in the lights. His form is strong and well built and in=
 his face you can see the likeness of OPTIMUS PRIME himself. Behind him lay=
 the large fallen forms of OPTIMUS and MEGATRON locked, even in death, in t=
he eternal struggle of good versus evil. <br>
<br>
And it is in this back d=
rop that LEO turned to face the assembled mechs and began to speak. <br>
<b=
r>
"Autobots, Maximals!" LEO's voice is a rich baritone, one that easily ca=
rried across the room. "I am sure that you have been all wondering just wha=
t this meeting is about." He smiled a warm and inviting smile as he looked =
around the room. "And for those who don't know me, I am LEO and have been n=
amed a PRIME by the council of elders on Cybertron." He paused for a moment=
 for that to take affect and then continued, "and what I have come here to =
talk about is Earth, and what we are doing here." <br>
<br>
LEO paused to m=
ake sure that everyone was keeping up and then continued, "I have been sent=
 by the high council and have been discussing matters with both Your Lord E=
lder as well as Legacy, both of whom have been instrumental in cataloging e=
vents here on Earth, and what has been found we find disturbing."<br>
<br>
=
There was a glance from LORD ELDER to LEO, but it was a nod of agreement, e=
ven from LEGACY there was a very slight nod, his single optic pulsing sligh=
tly. <br>
<br>
"Does anyone here know how many ships have crash landed here=
 on this planet since you have been here?" LEO stopped for a moment as he l=
ooked at those in the crowd, his optics turning to look at each of the Maxi=
mals and Autobots who were present. <br>
<br>
There were some in the audien=
ce who tentatively raised a hand and perhaps even a few who raised it with =
confidence, but most kept their hands down, unsure. <br>
<br>
"What ever yo=
u think that number is, multiply it several times." LEO PRIME's words were =
frim and full of convition, "You have to factor in the Predacons and Decept=
icons that have crash landed here too, and then there are the ships that cr=
ashed and had no survivors and so may have not been reported, and of course=
 the largest one that crash landed into the ocean."<br>
<br>
LEO PRIME paus=
ed for a moment again to let that fact sink in and then he spoke. "Most of =
these ships contained alien minerals, alien metals and alien technologies, =
objects that have no business being here on this planet at this time." <br>=

<br>
Gesturing at the audience LEO PRIME asked another question, "Does any=
one care to hazard a guess at how many tons of it are here on the Earth now=
?" <br>
<br>
He paused again to look at the audience, fewer raising their h=
ands. <br>
<br>
"Or how about the last time there was some major battle and=
 you blew off a piece of someone's armor, or they lost a weapon, or perhaps=
 that happened to you?" <br>
<br>
LEO PRIME's optic's brightened as he went=
 on, "Has anyone noticed that the humanoids on the planet are beginning to =
learn from us, learning how to use tools and communicate ideas at a faster =
rate than they historical should have?"<br>
<br>
Slamming his hands down on=
 the podium he continued in a stronger voice, "Mechs we are having an impac=
t on this planet, one that we should not be having. The humans have to proc=
eed unmolested on a planet that is supposed to be in a pristine condition w=
hen they inherit it. There should be no leftover smog from our smelting of =
ore, and it should not be being deprived of the very minerals that the huma=
ns will need to survive. It should not be seeded with technologies that hum=
ans should not be able to fathom for another several million years, and we =
definitely should not be having cities here, complete with internal crime a=
nd slums."<br>
<br>
LEO straightened as he looked over his audience to be s=
ure that he still had their attention. He nodded at the affect that he had.=
 "YES, we have to stop Unicron and his minions! And YES, we have to round u=
p the Predacons and other assorted criminals that are still running around =
on this planet. More of which seem to be arriving daily." <br>
<br>
Gesturi=
ng at the audience again LEO sighed, "But we cannot make the Earth our perm=
anent living quarters, at least not yet. We have reports of civilians here,=
 setting up shop . . . setting up families." He paused again to look at the=
 audience, "This planet belongs to the humans and the other animals that li=
ve here, not us. We do not have the right!" <br>
<br>
LEO PRIME leaned into=
 the audience, "If we continue on the course that we are now, we are no bet=
ter than the Predacons who take what they want. We are Maximals and Autobot=
s, we are better than that. We are here to defend it, but this planet, this=
 place, it is not our home, and we cannot, through our desire to defend it =
turn it into one, nor can we allow the Predacons to do so either."<br>
<br>=

He straightened, "It is time for a change."<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Presto=
n<br>
<br>
</p>
